H0.text: Barometer is the device used to measure the size of an earthquake, which is a vibration of Earthâ€™s crust.

H1.text: Doppler radar is the device used to measure the size of an earthquake, which is a vibration of Earth's crust.

H2.text: Depth scale is the device used to measure the size of an earthquake.

H3.text: A seismograph is the device used to measure the size of an earthquake, which is a vibration of Earth's crust.

A4.text: A seismometer is an instrument that responds to ground displacement and shaking caused by quakes, volcanic eruptions, and explosions.

A5.text: Such data is used to locate and characterize earthquakes, and to study the internal structure of Earth.
